Aputtaka Sutta：1．Aputtaka Sutta．-Contains the earlier part of the story of Aputtaka as given above，and the moral to be drawn therefrom：namely，that the mean man，who acquires wealth，pleases neither himself nor others，but is like a lake of delicious waters lying in a savage region．On the other hand，the rich man who is generous is like a lake near a village．S．i．89-91．

2．Aputtaka Sutta．-Contains an account of Aputtaka’s past，as related above; the wealth that a man stores here has to be left behind for others; hence let him make a good store for life elsewhere by using this wealth well．S．i．91-3．
